intro: Ternstroemia pavoniana var. brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and are borne in clusters. The variety brachypoda is distinguished by its shorter stems compared to the typical form of Ternstroemia pavoniana.
